titles: A brief director for those that would send their letters to any parts of England, Scotlaud, or Ireland. Or A list of all the carriers, waggoners coaches, posts, ships, barks, hoys, and passage-boats, that come to London, from the most parts and places, by land & sea Alphabetically printed, so that none may pretend ignorance, who would gladly send, but know not where to carry their letters. With the dayes when they come, and when they return. And also to send letters to the most habitable parts of the world, and to have an answer.
author: Taylor, John, 1580-1653.
notes: Attributed by Wing to John Taylor.
Reproduction of the original at the Harvard University Library.
keywords: Postal service --  England --  London --  Early works to 1800.
Postal service --  England --  Handbooks, manuals, etc. --  Early works to 1800.
